meanings.definition: The act of cutting out or removing a part of something, especially in surgery.
meanings.sent1: During the exsections, the surgeon carefully removed the tumor from the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: The exsections of the damaged tissue were necessary to improve the patient's health.
meanings.sent3: The exsections of the cake slices were so precise that everyone got an equal piece.
meanings.sent4: Her exsections of negative thoughts from her mind left her feeling lighter and happier.
meanings.sent5: The exsections of weeds from the garden made it look neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: The process of excising or removing tissue from a living organism.
meanings.sent1: The exsections of the infected tissue helped prevent the spread of the disease.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian performed exsections to remove the foreign object from the dog's stomach.
meanings.sent3: The exsections of the rotten fruit from the basket saved the rest from spoiling.
meanings.sent4: His exsections of unnecessary expenses from his budget allowed him to save more money.
meanings.sent5: The exsections of dead branches from the tree promoted new growth.

meanings.definition: The surgical removal of a portion of an organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: After the exsections, the patient's recovery was smooth and successful.
meanings.sent2: The exsections of the damaged lung tissue were crucial for the patient's well-being.
meanings.sent3: The exsections of the excess fabric from the dress made it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her exsections of toxic people from her life brought her peace and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The exsections of the old wallpaper revealed a beautiful, clean wall underneath.
